intro: Arabidella trisecta, commonly known as the three-lobed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes many common weeds and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of serrated, lobed leaves and a single, hollow stem that supports a yellow flower head. Its flowers develop into fluffy, white seed heads that are easily dispersed by the wind. Arabidella trisecta is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a common weed in various habitats.
